case_vignette: A 31-year-old man is brought in to the clinic by his sister because she is concerned about his behavior since the death of their mother 2 months ago. The patient’s sister states that he has always been a ‘loner’ and preferred being by himself than socializing with others. His social isolation resulted in him being ‘socially awkward’, as described by his family. However, 2 months ago, when he found out about the death of their mother, he showed little emotion and attended her funeral in jeans and a dirty T-shirt which upset the rest of their family. When asked about it, he shrugged and said he was in a hurry to get to the funeral and “just left the house with what I had on.” He does not speak much during the interview, allowing his sister to speak on his behalf. His sister insists that he has ‘always been like this’, quiet and a complacent child who had no interest in playing with other children. The patient currently lives alone and spends his time repairing and building electrical appliances, and his sister is worried that his self-imposed isolation is making it ‘impossible for him to interact with other people normally’. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been feeling like keeping to myself, don't really talk much, and I've been staying alone more since my mom passed away.
I'm sorry to hear that. How long have you been feeling this way?
I guess I've always liked being by myself, even before my mom passed away two months ago.
Have you noticed any changes in your sleep, appetite, or energy levels recently?
No, nothing's changed with my sleep, how much I eat, or my energy.
Does your preference to be alone interfere with your ability to work or maintain relationships?
Well, I live alone and spend my time fixing and building things, so it doesn't really get in the way of work, but it seems to make it tough to interact with people normally, according to my sister.
Do you experience feelings of sadness or loss of interest in activities you used to enjoy?
No, I don't really feel sad; I just keep doing what I like, which is working with electrical appliances.
Have you had any previous psychological or psychiatric evaluation or treatment?
No, I've never had any kind of psychological or psychiatric treatment before.
Does your family have any history of mental health conditions, such as depression, anxiety, or autism spectrum disorders?
My sister didn't mention anything about a family history of mental health conditions.
Do you find that you have rigid routines or habits that you prefer not to change?
I just stick to what I do, like repairing and building electrical appliances; I don't really like to change things much.
Do you have difficulty understanding social cues or how to respond to social situations?
Yeah, my family says I'm socially awkward and I guess I don't interact with other people normally.
Final Diagnosis: Schizoid Personality Disorder

Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been keeping to myself a lot, preferring to be alone, and my family thinks I'm socially awkward and quiet.
How long have you been experiencing these feelings of preferring to be alone?
I've always preferred to be by myself; my family says I've been like this since I was a child.
Have you experienced any changes in mood or behavior recently?
No, my behavior has been the same, but my sister is more concerned since our mother passed away two months ago.
Did your mother's passing affect your daily routines or feelings of wanting to be alone?
Not really, I've continued to spend my time alone, working on electrical appliances as I did before.
Do you have difficulty understanding social cues like body language or facial expressions?
Yes, my family implies that I'm not good at interacting with people normally.
Do you find any routine or repetitive behavior comforting or hard to stop, such as working on electrical appliances?
Yes, I spend my time repairing and building electrical appliances and it's what I like to do.
Do you currently take any medication or have any other diagnosed medical conditions?
No, I'm not on any medication or have any other diagnosed conditions.
Do you have any relatives with similar traits or who have been diagnosed with developmental disorders?
I'm not aware of any relatives with similar traits or diagnoses.
Final Diagnosis: Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD)

I've been feeling really withdrawn, preferring to be by myself, and I haven't been showing much emotion, even for big events like my mother's passing.
